Red.en: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, they have zapped many people.

Blue.en: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, they have zapped many people.

Yellow.en: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.

Gold.en: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

Silver.en: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

Crystal.en: During the study of this Pokémon, it was discovered that its components are not found in nature.

Ruby.en: Voltorb was first sighted at a company that manufactures Poké Balls. The link between that sighting and the fact that this Pokémon looks very similar to a Poké Ball remains a mystery.

Sapphire.en: Voltorb is extremely sensitive - it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Poké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.

Emerald.en: It bears an uncanny and unexplained resemblance to a Poké Ball. Because it explodes at the slightest shock, even veteran trainers treat it with caution.

FireRed.en: A life-form whose identity is unknown. It is said to screech or suddenly selfdestruct.

LeafGreen.en: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

Diamond.en: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

Pearl.en: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

Platinum.en: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

HeartGold.en: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

SoulSilver.en: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

Black.en: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

White.en: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

Black 2.en: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on contact.

White 2.en: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on contact.

X.en: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

Y.en: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

Omega Ruby.en: Voltorb was first sighted at a company that manufactures Poké Balls. The link between that sighting and the fact that this Pokémon looks very similar to a Poké Ball remains a mystery.

Alpha Sapphire.en: Voltorb is extremely sensitive - it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Poké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.
